contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated positively. It can also be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "every part of you has been harmed" or "someone has harmed every part of you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublenegatives]])
This can be stated in positive form. Alternate translation: "If you continue to believe in me, you will certainly remain safe" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublenegatives]])
contextId.glQuote: If you do not remain firm in faith, surely you will not remain secure

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be written as a positive statement. Alternate translation: "Each animal will have a mate" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublenegatives]])
contextId.glQuote: None will lack for a mate

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is a slight exaggeration as Hezekiah showed them many things, but not everything. Also, this can be expressed positively. Alternate translation: "Hezekiah showed them almost everything in his house and in his kingdom" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublenegatives]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: There was nothing in his house, nor in all his kingdom, that Hezekiah did not show them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be expressed positively. Alternate translation: "I showed them all the valuable things in my palace" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublenegatives]])
contextId.glQuote: There is nothing among my valuable things that I have not shown them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be expressed positively. Alternate translation: "I have spoken plainly and clearly" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublenegatives]])
contextId.glQuote: I have not spoken in secret
